Comments_Questions: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload  (amount of time required to prepare, in relation to the subject area and content)
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
Please comment on: Visitors, if any (evaluate the contribution to the course of each visitor, by name)
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
Comments_List: Not too much work, but it often felt extraneous / unnecessary.  I didn't feel like I learned from the assignments we did.
The class is an excellent opportunity to engage a critical topic. It is taught superbly by an expert (which is rare to find) with excellent cases.
There was a reasonable amount of reading, and I appreciated the variety.
The course often felt meandering. Would have liked more structure, etc.
As an SOM student, I found the class an excellent learning opportunity. The combination of material, assignments, instruction, and fellow students made it a very rewarding experience.

The sequence of the course led to a natural arc. I found the syllabus sometimes difficult to read, especially with the details about the final project embedded in the middle of the document. 

I enjoyed when the classes opened up for discussion led by the students.
I wish that there was a little more mix of lecture and discussion. The class is quite long and can get monotonous.
Greg knows SO MUCH, but isn't always effective at communicating it in a way that helps students internalize and apply the lessons.

The instruction was fabulous. I believe that Greg uniquely equipped to teach the topic and suspect that nobody in the field is better qualified. I appreciate of the opportunity to learn from his experience.
Greg is a very knowledgeable professional, and I enjoyed learning from his breadth of experience.
The class can get lethargic, and there are times the instructor failed to hold my attention.
More focus. More frameworks. More concrete things we're expected to have *learned* at the end of each class.
